intro: Lappula microcarpa var. heterogenea, commonly known as the heterogeneous lappula, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, characterized by its small, cruciform flowers. The plant typically grows in disturbed soils and can be found in meadows, roadsides, and waste areas. Its leaves are lanceolate and often have a slightly hairy texture. The fruit is a short, dry capsule that contains several small seeds.
